title: Blue Jays total 45 runs, 63 hits in sweep of Rox
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. had four hits, including a home run, and the Blue Jays finished off a three-game sweep of the Rockies in which they had 63 hits and scored 45 runs.

title: NFLPA gets clarity: Players' own smelling salts OK
content: The NFL clarified a memo sent to clubs on Tuesday, saying players will still be able to whiff smelling salts during games this season as long as the team doesn't provide them.

title: Red Sox sign rookie Anthony to 8-year extension
content: Rookie Roman Anthony has signed an eight-year extension with the Red Sox. The deal is worth $130 million and could escalate as high as $230 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Son signs deal, calls MLS move 'dream come true'
content: LAFC's blockbuster summer signing Son Heung-Min said his move to the MLS club is a "dream come true" after a 10-year run with Tottenham Hotspur.

title: Kittredge, booed a day ago, has immaculate inning
content: Less than a day after he was booed off the mound in a loss to the Reds, Cubs reliever Andrew Kittredge threw an immaculate inning Wednesday, Chicago's first since 2022.

title: Mboko rallies into Montreal final, will play Osaka
content: Canadian teenager Victoria Mboko beat ninth-seeded Elena Rybakina 1-6, 7-5, 7-6 (4) to advance to the National Bank Open final, where she will meet four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka.

title: Miami makes Leagues Cup quarters with Messi out
content: Inter Miami beat Pumas UNAM in their final group game of the 2025 Leagues Cup on Wednesday night at Chase Stadium to clinch a spot in the knockout round of the tournament.

title: Day: Ohio State QB battle to go 'down to the wire'
content: Ohio State's quarterback competition between Julian Sayin and Lincoln Kienholz remains too close to call, coach Ryan Day says.

title: Bring on the reinforcements! Returning players who could swing MLB's playoff races
content: These injured stars expected to come off the IL could prove as good as any trade deadline blockbuster.

title: Can loading up on relievers at the deadline win you a World Series? We found out
content: Contenders went all-in for relievers at this year's deadline. Here's how much bullpens really help in October.

title: Lakers' next era: Fits around Luka, LeBron's future, and why 2027 could change everything
content: The Lakers locked in Luka Doncic. Now what? NBA insiders examine the moves L.A. can and should make to build its next title team.

title: What to watch over the next three weeks, including Ryder Cup spots
content: The playoffs start Thursday in Memphis with spots in the Tour Championship on the line. But that's not all that's at stake, with players jockeying for spots on the Ryder Cup teams.

title: 'Steal reps' and 'losing ground': How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: Draft tips for superflex, keeper, dynasty and other nontraditional formats
content: Mike Clay discusses his draft approach in various intensive league structures that get less attention.

title: Garrett Nussmeier's dad prepared him for the big moments. None will be bigger than 2025
content: The quarterback's dad is the offensive coordinator for the Saints. His mom is from Louisiana. Now, he has a shot to leave his stamp on the state.

title: 'Raw end of the stick': Taurasi opens up on being benched for Olympic gold medal game in new documentary
content: A new docuseries sheds light on key parts of the retired star's WNBA, Olympic and overseas basketball career.

title: Transgender athlete debate rolls on six months after executive order
content: Six months after President Trump signed an executive order banning trans women from women's sports, these athletes are still trying to find ways to compete, and battles around their participation continue.

title: Keith Tkachuk on Matthew, Brady, Olympic gold and his Hall of Fame snub
content: "There's nothing better than seeing your kids do what they love to do best," Tkachuk said of his All-Star sons.

title: Bridgewater talks coaching suspension at Bucs training camp
content: The new Tampa Bay quarterback talked publicly for the first time since his coaching suspension from his alma mater, Miami Northwestern High School.

title: The legend Son Heung-Min is now headed to MLS, LAFC
content: In Son Heung-min, LAFC and MLS are getting an icon, legend and possibly the greatest Asian player of all time.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye move for PSG star Bradley Barcola
content: Liverpool could make another blockbuster move to sign Bradley Barcola from Paris Saint-Germain. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 11: The final weekend
content: Three teams have clinched playoff bids. Who else will qualify? Here's how the teams line up heading into Boston.

title: How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Chris Boucher to the Celtics
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Looking for late-season heroes? Six players to target
content: A lot of teams made strong postseason pushes at the MLB trade deadline. What are you going to do with your team as the fantasy trade deadline approaches?

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: Kurnool police launch ‘Nenu Traffic Mithra’ WhatsApp number
content: The programme was launched to partner the people, auto drivers, and others with the police in discharging their duties and sought the support of the people and youth, Kurnool Superintendent of Police said

title: Jharkhand Congress demands Bharat Ratna for Shibu Soren, tribal university in his name
content: Congress held a condolence meet at the party's state headquarters here and paid tributes to the JMM co-founder, who breathed his last at a private hospital in Delhi on August 4

title: Poll authorities fault me for their mistake by issuing me notice for 2 EPIC numbers: Tejashwi
content: The former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister also claimed that “a good reply” was being drafted for the notice, sent last week, which would “leave them with nothing to say”.

title: U.S. tariffs: ‘We should also raise it to 50%,’ says Shashi Tharoor
content: “It will definitely have an impact because we have a trade of $90 billion with them and if everything becomes 50% more expensive buyers will also think why should they buy Indian things? If they do this, we should also impose a 50% tariff on American exports,” Mr. Tharoor said

title: G. Priyanka assumes charge as District Collector of Ernakulam
content: She says she will strive towards fulfilling both the State and Union governments’ priority projects and addressing the problems faced by the people

title: CREDAI urges government to ensure hassle-free road connectivity between Vizianagaram-Bhogapuram international airport
content: The existing roads are not adequate to meet the future traffic demands, CREDAI AP chapter president said

title: AHS course seat matrix revised for 15 colleges: KEA suggests opting for Choice-3
content: As a result, certain courses offered by some colleges have been withdrawn, and seats allotted for those courses have now been cancelled

title: Rupee rises 3 paise to close at 87.69 against U.S. dollar
content: Forex traders said weak crude oil prices and a decline in the U.S. Dollar index supported the rupee. However, muted domestic markets and foreign fund outflows capped sharp gains

title: Share names of electors included and excluded through signed oath: Karnataka chief electoral officer asks Rahul Gandhi
content: In a letter to Gandhi soon after he levelled allegations of vote fraud, the State poll officer said that during a press conference in the national capital, “you had mentioned about the inclusion of ineligible electors and exclusion of eligible electors in the Electoral Rolls...”

title: Anantapur police launch month-long drive to curb accidents
content: The police have also been creating awareness on the danger involved in drunken driving as it may lead to fatalities and asked the drivers not to drive their vehicle under the influence of alcohol

title: BJP slams Congress over poll rigging allegations, Tipu-KRS claims in Karnataka
content: Accuses Congress of spreading misinformation, distorting history, and attempting to divert public attention from its failures in governance

title: Kerala HC orders interim stay on proceedings in FIR against actor Shwetha Menon
content: Court issues notice to Kerala and the complainant on whose complaint a magisterial court had ordered lodging of FIR

title: Russian President Putin to visit India soon, says NSA Ajit Doval
content: National Security Adviser Doval announces Russian President Putin’s upcoming visit to India, discussing summit-level meetings and relationship milestones

title: Madras HC directs T.N. police to provide protection to theatres screening Vijay Deverakonda-starrer ‘Kingdom’ in case of disruptions
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy says, no one can threaten theatre owners or disrupt the screening of a movie just because of a disagreement with its content

title: Centre assures experts of engaging with US authorities on restrictions imposed on areca leaf sheath-based biodegradable dinnerware
content: On May 8, United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA) had issued an import alert imposing restrictions on biodegradable dinnerware made from arecanut leaf sheaths, including plates, and cups

title: Heavy rainfall alert in six Telangana districts on August 8
content: According to IMD, heavy rainfall is very likely to occur at isolated places in Nalgonda, Mahabubnagar, Nagarkurnool, Wanaparthy, Narayanpet and Jogulamba Gadwal districts

title: Experts suggest increasing priority area for Great Indian Bustards in Rajasthan: Centre tells SC
content: Additional Solicitor General Aishwarya Bhati, appearing for the Centre, said initially, around 99,000 square kilometer (sq km) area was held up in Rajasthan and Gujarat where renewable energy projects could not take place for conservation of Great Indian Bustards.

title: Collapsed and cracked NH 66 stretches in Kerala built in violation of Union Ministry specifications, finds inquiry report
content: Though inspection report commissioned by National Highways Authority of India has not fixed the responsibility on any agency, it exposes serious lapses in the road construction

title: SC collegium gives nod to appoint judicial officer as Punjab and Haryana HC judge
content: The three-member collegium, headed by Chief Justice B.R. Gavai, okayed Ramesh Kumari’s name as judge of the High Court.

title: Karnataka bus strike: Notices to over 17,000 employees, estimated loss is ₹20 crore
content: The strike was part of a state-wide agitation led by the Joint Action Committee (JAC) of Road Transport Corporation (RTC) employees, who launched an indefinite protest from 6 a.m. on August 5

title: Rahul Gandhi alleges ‘massive’ voter fraud, says ECI colluding with BJP to steal elections
content: Election Commission colluding with the BJP to steal elections, alleges Rahul Gandhi; Karnataka Chief Electoral Officer asks Mr. Gandhi to share names of electors included and excluded through a signed oath

title: Probe in rape case against Vedan in preliminary stage, says Kochi City police chief
content: District Police Chief (Kochi City) Putta Vimaladityasays accusations of financial transactions are also being probed and that relevant sections will be invoked in the event the police get hold of any evidence to substantiate these

title: India lost 18 times more forest than it gained between 2015–2019, study finds
content: From 2015 to 2019, all States in India experienced a net loss in forest cover; overall, India lost 18 square kilometres of forest for every 1 square kilometre gained.

title: Panneerselvam condemns Tiruppur policeman murder, blames DMK government’s inefficiency
content: During the past four years of the DMK government, murder in daylight, dacoity, circulation of illegal drugs, sexual assaults, among others have become daily affairs, Mr. Panneerselvam charged in his statement

title: Actor Shwetha Menon approaches Kerala High Court seeking to quash FIR
content: Alleging that FIR was malafide and ill-motivated, Shwetha Menon submits in her petition before High Court that the movies had been certified by CBFC and were publicly exhibited years ago

title: Odisha Police transfers ASI after self-immolation victim's father alleges refusal to lodge FIR
content: Odisha Police transfers ASI amid allegations of mishandling FIR, sparking controversy over self-immolation cases in the State

title: Sarasvati Mahal Library in Thanjavur declared a ‘library of historical and cultural importance’
content: It is regarded as one of the greatest Oriental manuscript libraries in the world and among the oldest libraries in Asia. It is believed the collections of the palace library began in the 16th century.

title: Karnataka rain: Overnight rain uproots trees, causes waterlogging and traffic snarls in Bengaluru
content: According to BBMP data, the East and Mahadevapura zones recorded three tree falls each, followed by two each in the R.R. Nagar and South zones, and one each in the West and Yelahanka zones

title: Three women farm workers injured in sloth bear attack near Puliyangudi in T.N.; residents stage protest
content: When the group of women were at work in the farm near the foothills of the Western Ghats at around 9 a.m. on Thursday, a sloth bear, which had entered the farm, reportedly attacked them

title: Kharge, Sonia other Opposition MPs protest against SIR in Parliament
content: There was a huge banner in front of the protesting MPs which read 'Discussion not deletion'. Another banner carried by the protesting MPs read 'SIR - Silent Invisible Rigging'.

title: Lucknow: ED raids in money laundering case against ex-U.P. Invest CEO, others
content: Four premises linked to an alleged middleman Nikant Jain and some others are being searched in the city under the PMLA

title: Madras High Court imposes cost of ₹1 lakh for filing PIL against appointment of senior IAS officers as T.N. govt. spokespersons
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan refuse to entertain the PIL petition at the admission stage itself

title: Anti-terror operation in J&K’s Kulgam enters seventh day
content: According to officials, intermittent exchange of firingin Kulgam district,  the longest so far this year continued for the seventh day on August 7.

title: NOTTO’s advisory on organ donation has troubling recommendations, say doctors and experts
content: NOTTO, in line with the 15th Indian Organ Donation Day 2025, had sent out the advisory with the approval of the competent authority of the Union Health Ministry

title: Watch: Dogs vs wolves | A shift in Maharashtra’s apex predators
content: The Indian grey wolf, the apex predator in Maharashtra’s Kadbanwadi grassland, is vanishing. Once 70 is strong, only six remain

title: Actors condemn complaint lodged against Shwetha Menon
content: FIR was registered against actor Shwetha Menon under Section 67 A of Information Technology Act, 2000 on charges of making financial gains through her roles in movies having alleged vulgar and obscene content

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: Army says rescue operations intensified, ad-hoc aviation base set up at Matli Helipad
content: The Army has said that three civilian fatalities have been confirmed, over 50 remain missing, and 9 Army personnel are feared missing following extensive damage to an Army post

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's shot nearly sends camera crew to the hospital
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old cricket prodigy, known for his explosive batting, recently stunned a Rajasthan Royals promotional shoot. His powerful straight drive narrowly missed the camera crew, highlighting both his raw talent and the potential danger of his shots.

title: An entire country is shifting to Australia, as first planned migration is underway
content: Tuvalu, a Pacific island nation, faces imminent submersion due to rising sea levels, prompting a groundbreaking planned migration. A treaty with Australia allows 280 Tuvaluans annually to gain permanent residency, accessing essential services.

title: NCERT forms expert panel to review Class 8 map after feedback on Maratha Empire depiction
content: NCERT has formed an expert committee to review textbook content following concerns about a Class 8 social science textbook. The dispute arose from a map depicting parts of Rajasthan under the Maratha Empire, which was contested by historians. NCERT emphasizes that the review aligns with the National Education Policy 2020, ensuring academic integrity and transparency through evidence-based decisions.

title: Explainer: Donald Trump’s 50% tariffs - will India budge on Russia crude oil trade?
content: Donald Trump's doubled tariffs on India, targeting its Russian oil trade, aim to pressure Putin on the Ukraine war. India faces a complex balancing act between maintaining ties with Russia and the US, its largest trading partner. While India may gradually reduce Russian oil dependency, a complete shift is unlikely due to economic and political considerations.

title: Voter fraud row: EC ups the ante, asks Rahul to sign oath; Cong MP reacts
content: The Karnataka Election Commission has demanded Congress leader Rahul Gandhi provide a formal declaration and names of allegedly wrongfully included electors to support his "vote theft" claim. The poll body emphasized the transparent preparation of electoral rolls, stating election results can only be challenged via an Election Petition in High Court.

title: ‘AI taking Jobs': Cofounder of the company Google bought for $32 bn
content: Wiz cofounder Ami Luttwak warns that AI-driven "vibe coding" is outpacing traditional cybersecurity, demanding a paradigm shift. With developers building applications at unprecedented speeds, centralized security models are becoming obsolete. Luttwak advocates for democratizing security through self-service tools integrated into developer workflows, making security accessible and impactful for everyone.

title: Fortnite downtime begins: Chapter 6 Season 4 update disrupts servers
content: Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4, "Shock 'N Awesome," is about to begin, following a typical downtime that lasts from August 7, 2025, at 2 AM ET. Players are met with a mechanical insectoid invasion led by Daigo's Kraken and a road that brings other Fortnite game mechanics like Mighty Morphin Power Rangers to life!

title: ‘Starship flight to Mars crewed by Optimus in Nov/Dec next year’: Elon Musk
content: Elon Musk has adjusted SpaceX's Mars mission timeline, pushing back the potential Starship launch to 2028 for an uncrewed flight and 2030 for a crewed mission. Technical challenges, including Starship failures and delays in mastering in-space propellant refuelling, have contributed to this shift.

title: ChatGPT stops answering these questions: Safeguards user well-being
content: In August 2025, OpenAI updated ChatGPT to avoid directly answering emotionally sensitive questions, prioritizing ethical responsibility. The AI now offers prompts for self-reflection and encourages users to seek human support. This change, influenced by experts, aims to prevent emotional overdependence and promote healthier digital habits by establishing boundaries around emotional support.

title: Trade war: Trump's 'reciprocal' tariffs go into effect today - check full list of countries
content: US President Trump's new tariffs, effective Thursday, impose higher duties on exports from over 60 countries, including India. A 25% tariff on Indian goods, totaling 50%, is a consequence of India's Russian oil purchases, deemed a national security threat. Brazil also faces a 50% tariff, while others like Canada and the UK have varying rates.

title: Chess | The Mother's Gambit: How a housewife's trick created a record-breaking 8-year-old
content: Tanishka Garg, an eight-year-old from Bathinda, has become Punjab's youngest female FIDE-rated chess player, showcasing her strategic talent at a young age. Her journey began unexpectedly when she joined her brother's coaching sessions, quickly surpassing expectations and winning multiple titles.

title: EXPOSED! Kerala govt said they won't spend on inviting Messi, RTI reply says differently
content: The Kerala government's plan to bring Lionel Messi to Kerala has sparked controversy. Sports Minister V. Abdurahiman's Spain trip, costing Rs 13 lakh, contradicts earlier assurances that no public funds would be used for the invitation. Despite the minister's efforts and Argentina's popularity in Kerala, the visit is now unlikely due to scheduling issues.

title: Odisha student immolates self after threats from ex — 4th such case
content: In Kendrapada, a college student allegedly died by suicide. Her former boyfriend threatened to release private photos. The father blames police inaction. He claims the police did not file a complaint earlier. Instead, they advised blocking the number. An investigation is underway. Police assure accountability if negligence is found. Opposition parties demand immediate arrest.

title: 2025 NFL preseason schedule: Where to watch, teams, weeks, dates, times
content: NFL enthusiasts are eagerly awaiting the 2025 season, with the preseason games acting as a thrilling prelude. Starting August 7, the three-week preseason schedule showcases all 32 teams. The Philadelphia Eagles, fresh off their Super Bowl LIX victory, will clash with the Dallas Cowboys on September 4, marking the season's official kickoff.

title: US-Russia talks: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin to meet next week
content: The Kremlin announced that a meeting between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin is expected to occur as early as next week. This meeting comes as Trump seeks to address Russia's ongoing war against Ukraine and its trade practices. While the venue has been agreed upon in principle, details are still being worked out between the two nations.

title: 'Unzipped his pants': Gurgaon woman recounts horror while waiting for cab
content: A Gurgaon woman has filed a police complaint alleging sexual harassment near Rajiv Chowk. She claims a man unzipped his pants and masturbated in front of her while she waited for a cab. The police initially refused to register her complaint online, and the women's helpline went unanswered.

title: Save the date! Virat Kohli and Rohit to make India comeback
content: Indian cricket stars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to play in the ODI series against Australia in October. This marks their return to international cricket after retiring from Test matches. The first match will be in Perth on October 19. Subsequent matches are scheduled for Adelaide and Sydney.

title: Duleep Trophy: After impressive captaincy debut in England, Gill to lead NZ
content: Shubman Gill, fresh off his impressive captaincy in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, is set to lead North Zone in the upcoming Duleep Trophy, commencing August 28 in Bengaluru. Gill's stellar performance against England included amassing 754 runs, surpassing Gavaskar's record for most runs by an Indian captain in a five-Test series.

title: Indian startup builds world’s largest single-piece 3D-printed Inconel rocket engine
content: Indian space startup Agnikul Cosmos achieves a milestone. They build the world's largest single-piece 3D-printed rocket engine. The engine is made from Inconel. Agnikul also secures a US patent for its design and manufacturing process. This innovation reduces production time and complexity. It strengthens India's position in the global space technology sector.

title: Proud mum Tanuja whistles at awards show on daughter Kajol’s request
content: Veteran actress Tanuja, at 81, captivated the Maharashtra State Film Awards by whistling at Kajol's request, earning praise from Anupam Kher for her youthful spirit. Kajol, honored with the Raj Kapoor Award on her birthday, acknowledged the significance of following in her mother's footsteps. She was recently seen in 'Sarzameen' and will be co-hosting 'Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle'.

title: Former Giants star Dave Gallagher passes away at 73 after leaving NFL to become a surgeon
content: Dave Gallagher, a former NFL player for the New York Giants who transitioned to a career as an orthopedic surgeon, has passed away at 73. After a brief football stint, he pursued his lifelong dream of medicine, later coaching youth football in Indiana. A service honoring his life will be held on August 19th.

title: Trump’s 50% tariff on India: How are ‘secondary tariffs’ different from ‘secondary sanctions’?
content: Donald Trump has announced a 25% 'secondary tariff' on Indian goods, effective August 27, to penalize India's oil purchases from Russia. This aims to pressure India to sever ties with Russia, similar to secondary sanctions. The US tracks oil tanker movements via satellite to monitor countries buying Russian oil.

title: 'If India doesn’t matter to them ...': Tharoor calls for 50% tariff on US
content: Speaking about the potential impact of 50 per cent US tariffs, Tharoor remarked, "It will have an impact because we have trade of about $90 billion. If things get costly by 50 per cent, then people will also think before purchasing them. If our competitors, Vietnam, Indonesia, Pakistan, Bangladesh, China, will sell products at a lower cost... it will have an impact.​​​​"

title: 'It's only been 8 hours': Secondary sanctions? 2x tariffs on India a 'warning' to China, says Trump
content: Asked at a White House event why New Delhi is being singled out for secondary tariffs when China is buying more Russian oil than India does, Trump interrupted the questioner twice to say "It's okay...it's okay" before warning there will be more secondary sanctions against countries buying Russian oil and gas.

title: 24 college friends, reunited after 35 years for Uttarkashi trip, missing
content: A group of 24 friends from Awasari Khurd village, Pune, who reunited for the 'Char Dham Yatra' after 35 years, have become unreachable following the cloudburst and heavy rainfall in Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand.

title: 'Hope we meet again': Chris Woakes reveals Rishabh Pant's heartfelt voice note
content: England's Chris Woakes and India's Rishabh Pant, both injured during the intense Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, shared a heartwarming exchange. Woakes, recovering from a dislocated shoulder, appreciated Pant's supportive message. Despite the on-field battles, their interaction highlighted mutual respect and sportsmanship. Woakes also supported Ben Stokes' opposition to injury substitutes, emphasising resilience in cricket.

title: Chased by 25 men, 60-year-old found dead at police station
content: A 60-year-old man, A Rajan, was discovered dead in a sub-inspector's room at the Bazaar police station in Coimbatore. Rajan had sought protection, claiming to be pursued by a group. After being asked to return in the morning, he entered the room and was later found hanging. Police Commissioner A Saravana Sundar has ordered an investigation and departmental action.

title: 'Anyone would do a better job': Trump's 'no talent' dig at Jimmy Fallon, Kimmel
content: Donald Trump asserted that late-night hosts Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Kimmel, and Jimmy Fallon lack talent and predicted their shows' cancellation. Trump referenced Colbert's program termination, attributing it to a lack of talent and anticipating similar fates for Fallon and Kimmel. He also commented on Howard Stern's declining influence after Stern supported Hillary Clinton.

title: Bigg Boss 19 Promo: Salman Khan introduces new theme ‘Gharwalon Ki Sarkaar’
content: Bigg Boss is returning for its 19th season on August 24, promising high drama with a parliament-inspired theme, ‘Gharwalon Ki Sarkaar’. This season, housemates will wield unprecedented power to make decisions, leading to potential conflicts and consequences.

title: Her bones tell Gaza story, but Grok thinks it is Yemen: Can AI be trusted?
content: A recent photograph from Gaza, depicting a severely malnourished girl, has ignited controversy after Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, misidentified it. The image, taken by AFP photojournalist Omar al-Qattaa, shows nine-year-old Mariam Dawwas, a victim of the ongoing humanitarian crisis exacerbated by the Israeli blockade. Grok falsely claimed the photo was from Yemen, leading to accusations of disinformation against those sharing the authentic image.

title: Haryana singer Baaz Sran who called jail a govt house held after 10 years
content: Jagsir Singh, a proclaimed offender since 2016, was arrested. He evaded police for nine years. He was living under the identity of Punjabi singer Baaz Sran. Sran was arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau. The arrest was in connection with a 2015 opium seizure case. Sran's song 'Sarkari Kothi' ironically talks about jail.

title: Trump’s 50% tariffs on India: What does it mean for the stock market
content: Donald Trump's proposed 50% tariff on Indian exports casts a shadow over Indian stock markets, impacting sectors like textiles and auto ancillaries. While export-oriented businesses face challenges, analysts suggest focusing on domestic consumption-driven sectors. A potential market dip presents a buying opportunity for long-term investors, leveraging India's resilient economy.

title: Move over Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, Rohit Sharma! Shubman Gill puts captaincy worries to rest
content: In a thrilling Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, India drew 2-2 with England, marking a generational shift under debutant captain Shubman Gill. The 25-year-old led a young squad to a historic draw, showcasing exceptional leadership and scoring a remarkable 754 runs.

title: Jen Pawol makes MLB history, becomes league’s first female umpire at 48
content: Jen Pawol is set to make history this weekend in Atlanta, becoming the first woman to umpire a Major League Baseball regular-season game. After years in the minor leagues, including umpiring the Triple-A National Championship, Pawol will work the bases during Saturday's double-header and call balls and strikes on Sunday.

title: EXPLOSIVE! Ex-Pakistan cricketer accuses Siraj of ball-tampering - READ
content: Following India's thrilling six-run victory over England in the fifth Test, former Pakistan cricketer Shabbir Ahmed has ignited controversy by alleging that the Indian team used Vaseline to maintain the ball's shine. Ahmed suggested that the umpires should have the ball examined in a lab, questioning how it retained its shine even after 80 overs.

title: 'Ready for sacrifice': Trump tariff spike - No deal at farmers' cost, PM Modi says
content: "For us, the interest of our farmers is our top priority. India will never compromise on the interests of farmers, fishermen and dairy farmers," PM Modi said while speaking at the MS Swaminathan Centenary International Conference.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Shubman scored the most runs, but...' - Ex-RCB all-rounder
content: Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid have lauded KL Rahul's batting technique in the recent Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, despite Shubman Gill scoring more runs. Ali highlighted Rahul's crucial role and believes he's among the world's best, urging him to play more freely.

title: Law student stabbed to death over jumping line at petrol pump
content: In Bhopal, a 22-year-old law student, Sanskar Babele, was fatally stabbed following a dispute at a petrol pump. The altercation began when three unidentified individuals demanded to refuel their scooter before Babele and his friend. The situation escalated, leading to a chase and a brutal stabbing.

title: J&K: Bus carrying CRPF jawans falls into gorge in Udhampur; 3 killed, several injured
content: Tragedy struck in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district as a CRPF vehicle accident near Kandva claimed the lives of three personnel and injured twelve others. Following the incident in the Basantgarh area, police initiated a rescue operation, promptly transferring the injured to a nearby hospital.

title: UP STF guns down 2 shooters accused in journalist Raghvendra Vajpayee’s murder
content: In a joint operation, Uttar Pradesh STF and Sitapur police fatally shot wanted criminals Raju and Sanjay Tiwari, each carrying a ₹1 lakh reward. The brothers were the prime suspects in the murder of journalist Raghvendra Vajpayee. Raju was also wanted for the 2006 murder of a Sub-Inspector, while Sanjay was involved in a 2011 murder case.

title: ‘We don't want to hurt ourselves’: Trump adviser justifies no Russian oil tariffs on China
content: Trump's White House trade adviser Peter Navarro defended the US decision to impose additional tariffs on India for buying Russian oil, citing India's high tariffs on American goods. He contrasted this with China, where existing high tariffs already exist.

title: Jaz Agassi’s sweet support for dad Andre Agassi — Steffi Graf moment resurfaces
content: Andre Agassi addressed Shore Capital Partner’s Leadership Academy in New York City on July 14, 2025, emphasizing leadership, mindset, and purpose. Following the fireside chat with Jish Bia, Agassi's daughter, Jaz, expressed her admiration on Instagram. Agassi has previously discussed parenting and his efforts to break negative cycles, highlighting his and Steffi Graf's influence on their children.

title: Three CRPF personnel killed, 15 injured after vehicle falls into gorge in J&K’s Udhampur
content: As per sources, the vehicle carring CRPF personnel, skidded off the road and fell into a deep gorge  in the Basant Garh area of Udhampur.

title: Uddhav Thackeray in Delhi: Dinner diplomacy with Rahul Gandhi, INDIA Bloc meeting on cards
content: Addressing a press conference, Uddhav Thackeray also demanded a discussion over the resignation of the Vice-President

title: Koodalmanikyam temple row: Controversy over appointment of Ezhava youth for Kazhakam | Explained
content: Kerala temple row ignites debate over caste, tradition, and the right to serve as constitutional values clash with inherited ritual roles

title: From shutdown to success: Komalapuram mill in Kerala weaves a revival story
content: Backed by Kerala government, Komalapuram Spinning and Weaving Mills in Alappuzha, a public sector undertaking, has recorded a turnover of ₹35.7 crore in 2024-25

title: Two women die after speeding truck runs over them in Kerala's Kollam
content: A third person, a 50-year-old autorickshaw driver, was seriously injured in the incident near Kottarakara

title: Oppose encroachment lawfully, Assam CM Himanta tells indigenous groups
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma notes the growing anger among the indigenous people and warns against any attempt to harm the Assamese community

title: Cash discovery row: Supreme Court dismisses Justice Varma's plea seeking invalidation of panel report
content: A Bench of Justices Dipankar Datta and A.G. Masih said Justice Varma's conduct does not inspire confidence and his plea should not be entertained

title: Kerala State Electricity Board gets regulatory commission’s approval for four battery energy storage systems at substations
content: BESS units planned at sub-stations at Sreekantapuram in Alappuzha, Pothencode in Thiruvananthapuram, Mulleria in Kasaragod and Areacode in Malappuram to handle large volume of surplus solar power being generated

title: GST fraud: ED raids in West Bengal, Maharashtra and Jharkhand
content: At least a dozen premises in the three States were raided under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, sources said.

title: Infosys sets up Centre for Advance AI in Hubballi
content: Minister for Rural Development and Panchayat Raj and IT, BT Priyank Kharge has said that as state government was promoting innovations and new innovations were happening in Hubballi, Dharwad, Belagavi along with other centres in the state.

title: Bengal’s college teachers’ union, once led by luminaries including S. Radhakrishnan, turning 100
content: West Bengal College and University Teachers’ Association which began its centenary celebrations on August 3, will continue holding events throughout the year.

title: Toxic blaze triggers night-long explosions at cold storage facility in Sangareddy
content: Stored hazardous chemicals caused repeated explosions throughout the night. As the fire reacted with volatile substances, firefighters were forced to pause operations multiple times for safety.

title: India will not compromise with farmers’ interests: PM Modi
content: I know that, personally, I will have to pay a huge price (for taking such a stand). But I am ready for this, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Amartya Sen on SIR: ‘There should not be targeted attempt to eliminate voice of some citizens, especially from deprived parts of India’
content: Economist Amartya Sen speaks with The Hindu on the Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls in Bihar and other parts of India

title: Tiruppur special sub-inspector murder: Prime accused shot dead by police
content: Police sources said the accused, Manikandan, was shot near Upparu stream near Chikkanur by the SI Saravanakumar in “self-defence”

title: India's E20 petrol rollout sparks driver revolt
content: The government's fast-expanding ethanol programme aims to cut costly oil imports by blending petrol with ethanol

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 14 highlights: Lok Sabha passes Manipur GST (Amendment) Bill, Rajya Sabha passes The Coastal Shipping Bill
content: Opposition members continued loud protests in the House, demanding a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in Bihar; both Houses stand adjourned for the day

title: Uttarkashi flash floods rescue operation LIVE: 70 rescued, over 50 missing, says Army
content: Efforts were also stepped up to airlift advanced equipment to the worst-hit Dharali village to speed up the search for those trapped under the rubble, said officials

title: Analysis of Bihar SIR electoral rolls hints at higher voter deletions in Muslim-majority districts
content: Preliminary analysis hints at higher voter deletions in Muslim-majority districts and possibly high out-migration areas

title: 16 persons missing from Maharashtra's Jalgaon after cloudburst in Uttarkashi
content: Around 190 people have been rescued from Dharali following a devastating cloudburst that triggered massive flash floods and landslides in the area

title: Notification for Vice-President's election issued; nomination process begins
content: According to the notification, August 21 is the last date for filing nominations, while the documents will be scrutinised on August 22; Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post as Vice President on July 21

title: Bombay HC’s larger Bench to settle if caste scrutiny committees have power to recall orders based on fraud
content: Additional Government pleaders S.P. Sonpawale and Saie S. Joshi argued that scrutiny committees must retain the power to recall certificates obtained by fraud, even if such power is not expressly provided in the 2000 Act.

title: Cabinet approves new LIFT policy to attract top-tier IT/ITeS firms, GCCs
content: The Cabinet approved the new LIFT Policy 4.0 (2024–29), offering land at a nominal rate of ₹0.99 per acre to attract top-tier IT/ITeS firms, GCCs, and developers.

title: ‘It’s like writing a poem’: prize winner Rajula Srivastava on doing maths
content: Rajula Srivastava won the Maryam Mirzakhani New Frontiers Prize, an initiative of the Breakthrough Prize in Mathematics, in 2025 for her work in harmonic analysis and analytic number theory

title: R.G. Kar victim’s family to meet CBI Director, Home Minister
content: The visit by parents of the R.G. Kar victim to the national capital assumes significance as it comes ahead of August 9 march to Kalighat

title: U.P. Minister scolds PWD engineer for opening bridge without approval
content: The incident is latest of many instances in which U.P. Ministers come face-to-face with officials over violation of protocol and arbitrary actions

title: Groups of Ministers from Andhra to be sent on study tours to developed countries
content: The idea is to study the development projects there and bring innovative policies to the State, says the Chief Minister

title: Chhattisgarh High Court acquits man convicted for murdering kin on grounds of ‘legal insanity’
content: The HC held that an accused who seeks exoneration from liability of an act under Section 84 has to prove legal insanity and not medical insanity

title: Trump non-committal on whether extra India tariffs will go with Russia-Ukraine ceasefire
content: After imposing additional tariffs on India for trading in arms and energy with Russia, U.S. President Donald Trump said other countries could follow suit, suggesting China by name as a possibility

title: Brinda Karat voices concern against Chhattisgarh’s approval for mining in Hasdeo region
content: The CPI(M) leader says there is no public interest involved in the project, and it will only lead to the exploitation of mineral resources for private gain

title: Leaders hail work of visionary scientist M.S. Swaminathan
content: In a panel discussion that followed the book release, Shashi Tharoor, said Dr. Swaminathan worked at a time when the memories of Bengal famine were haunting the country.

title: Bars in Andhra Pradesh allowed to operate until 11 p.m. as Cabinet approves new policy
content: Permits rooms allowed; new policy proposes a shift from auction system to lottery-based allocation; 10% of bar licences reserved for toddy tappers

title: Rahul Gandhi Makes "Stolen Votes" Charge, Poll Body Responds With Oath Dare
content: The reversal of the INDIA bloc's poll fortunes in the Maharashtra Assembly election just months after their strong show in the general election showed "something was not right", senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said today

title: Odisha Woman Stopped To Urinate On Roadside, Gang-Raped By 3
content: A tribal woman was allegedly gang-raped by three people in a forested area of Odisha's Angul district on Sunday, police said. Two minors were among the three arrested in connection with the case.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Atom Bombs Didn't Prevent World War III. Humans Did
content: Growing up in the latter stages of the Cold War, my generation didn't live with the sense of menace and the Bert the Turtle duck-and-cover drills baby boomers endured, but both cohorts were blessed by the absence of a large-scale war.

title: As Trump Doubles Tariff To 50%, What Are India's Options And Risks
content: India is likely to be among the countries worst hit by US President Donald Trump's trade offensive, with tariffs on Indian imports set to surge to 50% if a deal is not struck in three weeks.

title: "Not Diplomacy But Bullying By Buffoon-in-Chief": A Owaisi On Trump Tariff
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday slammed US President Donald Trump for imposing an additional 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, calling it "bullying by the buffoon-in-chief."

title: Nike, Adidas Pass Trump Tariff Costs To US Customers
content: US President Donald Trump's sweeping new tariffs on imports from more than 90 countries came into effect on Thursday.

title: Australia's Great Barrier Reef Records Largest Annual Coral Loss In 4 Decades
content: The Great Barrier Reef has experienced its greatest annual loss of live coral across most of its expanse in four decades of record-keeping, Australian authorities say.

title: Donald Trump, Vladimir Putin To Meet "In Coming Days": Kremlin
content: A meeting in the coming days between Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump has been agreed on, as a new Gallup poll found that Ukrainians are eager for a settlement that ends fight against Russia's invasion, said the Kremlin.

title: Tata Consultancy Services Salary Hike: Eligibility, Increment Details Here
content: India's largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has decided to roll out wage hikes ranging from two per cent to eight per cent for about 80% of its workforce from September 1, sources told NDTV Profit.

title: "Papa, We Won't Survive": Nepal Man's Last Call With Son Missing In Uttarkashi Flood
content: When migrant labourers from Nepal Kali Devi and her husband Vijay Singh completed their task and left Harsil Valley in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Tuesday, little did they imagine that they would perhaps be the sole survivors of an impending disaster

title: Viral Video Shows Woman Filming Herself On Thar Roof On Gurugram Flyover
content: A young woman sat on the roof of a moving SUV on a flyover near IFFCO Chowk in Gurugram. Her feet dangled over the front windshield of Thar, and she appeared to be recording herself.

title: 3 CRPF Jawans Killed, 10 Injured As Vehicle Overturns In J&K's Udhampur
content: Three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) jawans were killed and 10 were injured on Thursday in a road accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district.

title: Disguised As Sadhu, Man Visits Wife After 10 Years, Kills Her With Hammer
content: A man allegedly disguised himself as a monk (sadhu) and murdered his estranged wife with a hammer at her house in Delhi earlier this week, police said on Friday.

title: Japanese Automaker Toyota Cuts Profit Forecast Amid Trump Tariff Threat
content: The Trump administration in April imposed a 25 percent levy on Japanese cars imported into the United States, dealing a hefty blow to Japan and its crucial auto sector.

title: How Hamas Is Paying Salaries Despite Collapse Of Gaza's Economy
content: Hamas has continued to pay thousands of its civil servants through a covert, cash-based network, despite the collapse of Gaza's economy and the total destruction of its infrastructure.

title: India Data Breach Costs Reach New Record Level Of 22 Crores: Report
content: The average organisational cost of a data breach in India reached a new high of Rs 220 million (Rs 20 crore) in 2025 -- up 13 per cent (year-on-year), according to an IBM report released on Thursday.

title: Man Caught Flashing Woman In Gurugram. She Records Him, Shares Video
content: A model and digital content creator has alleged she was sexually harassed while waiting for a cab in Gurugram. The incident occurred last Friday, at around 11 am, when the woman returning from Jaipur was waiting for a cab.

title: Sensex, Nifty Decline In Early Trade As US Tariffs On Indian Goods Doubled
content: Benchmark equity indices Sensex and Nifty declined in early trade on Thursday as US President Donald Trump slapped an additional 25 per cent duty -- doubling it to 50 per cent -- on Indian goods over New Delhi's continued imports of Russian oil.

title: "Move Population, Bomb City": Inside Netanyahu's Gaza Takeover Plan
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's security cabinet is expected to meet on Thursday to finalise a decision on the expansion of Israel's military operations in Gaza, despite serious misgivings from senior military officers.

title: Explaining MLS' discovery rights: What were Müller's extra steps to Vancouver?
content: MLS commissioner don Garber speaks about the potential change to the league's schedule after the 2026 FIFA World Cup . atypical but significant mechanism in MLS's single-entity structure called the Discovery List . the regulation allows teams to "discover" and select up to five non-MLS players .

title: 20 sophomore NFL defenders who could stand out this season
content: twenty-seven rookies played at least 500 snaps on defense in 2024, a whopping 20 were defensive backs . a 500-snap threshold doesn't catch key players who sat out time or are expecting big roles this season . the defense's predraft reputation as a weaker group set a record .
